intro: Centropogon pedicellaris var. gallerensis, commonly known as the Gallic centropogon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that typically display vibrant colors. The plant features opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
